sub_title: Advisor Food System Resilience & Protracted Crises | WCDI & FAO
summary:
Advisor Food System Resilience & Protracted Crises for the Wageningen Centre for Development Innovation (WCDI) part of the Wageningen Univeristy and Research (WUR), on a loan of expert agreement with FAO, based in Nairobi. Working on strengthening the resilience of food systems in areas of protracted crises in South-Sudan, Sudan and Somalia. 

BSc graduate 'International Development Management' specialized in 'Disaster Risk Management'. Passionate about developmental challenges and multi-cultural dynamics in developing countries related to Disaster Risk Management and Resilience. Disasters and food insecurity are a result of a combination of natural and man-made hazards that are not dealt with accordingly and thus are linked to human and/or policy failure or mismanagement. Disasters provide an opportunity for change and therefore it is interesting to learn from disastrous events in order to develop on community/local/national/international level leading to increased disaster coping capacity and resilient capacities which link to the Sendai Framework. Linking relief to development by bottom-up, people-centered and context specific approaches enables people to become more resilient and food secure which is fundamental for development. This is what drives me. 

Core competences: project management, context analysis, disaster risk management, evidence-based and adaptive (programme) management, food system resilience, conflict analysis, community-managed processes, facilitation of multi-stakeholder processes, leadership and management, proposal writing, (hybrid) trainings and workshops in multi-cultural dynamics.

projects: [{'title': 'Food & Nutrition Security Resilience Programme (FNS-REPRO)', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'The Food and Nutrition Security Resilience Programme (FNS-REPRO) of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and Wageningen University & Research (WUR), is a four-year plan addressing the cause‑effect relationship between conflict and food insecurity in Somalia, South Sudan and Sudan. FNS-REPRO is the first programme in Eastern Africa specifically designed to foster peace and food security at scale.\n\nThe programme will employ a livelihood and resilience‑based approach in some of the least stable regions, where interventions are normally exclusively of a humanitarian nature. Its design will allow FAO, WUR and partners to set good examples of how to build food system resilience in protracted crises and strengthen cooperation across the humanitarian-development-peace nexus towards this end.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eelke', 'last_name': 'Boerema', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Advisor Food System Resilience & Protracted Crises | WCDI & FAO'}]}, {'title': 'Community-Managed Disaster Risk Reduction & Urban Resilience in Sierra Leone', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}}, 'description': 'Developing 2 project proposals with partner organisations CRS and AAD in Sierra Leone. Started implementation of two projects and established a project team for handover.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Eelke', 'last_name': 'Boerema', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Advisor Food System Resilience & Protracted Crises | WCDI & FAO'}]}]
